channel.title: Bracket Notation :: Introduction to Web Dev
channel.description: Understanding strings as sequential collections of characters gives us much more than just a mental model of how they are structured. JavaScript provides a rich collection of tools—including special syntax and operations—that allows us to work with strings. Bracket notation is the special syntax that allows us to access the individual characters that make up a string. To access a character, we use the syntax someString[i], where i is the index of the character we want to access. String indices are integers representing the position of a character within a given string, and they start at 0. Thus, the first character of a string has index 0, the second has index 1, and so on.
